In the future, Rosalie would like to build and expand her business so that she can ensure the financial security of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soap, shampoo, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 63 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 62 years old and married, with three children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell educational book business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional educational books to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell educational book business for 13 years and also earns an income from food-vending, buying and selling charcoal, and raising pigs. Leonila aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional educational books to sell.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn, a 27-year-old married mother of two, lives in the village of Bustamante, where she has operated a piggery business for almost three years. She earns Php 2,500 each time she sells a hog.

Ronalyn is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth, a 48-year-old married mother of seven from CPG, Bohol, has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. It is their sole source of income.

Bernadeth is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus enabling them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Bernadeth hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy  new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and buckets.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Maria Sol works hard to support her family. The operator of a general store business in the Philippines, she also earns income from a restaurant, a sugarcane farm, and rice sales.

Maria Sol is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell including soft drinks, coffee, soap, spices, noodles, etc. for her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, coffee, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Aurélio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 8 filhos residente em Machangulene desde 1987.
É operário e com o empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, barrotes e portas) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu maior desejo é conseguir educar seu filhos pelo que seu maior desafio é encontrar receitas suficientes para este fim.
texts.en:
Aurélio is married, the father of 8 children and has lived in Machangulene since 1987.

He's a factory worker and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, beams and doors) to continue his building work.

His greatest wish is to be able to educate his children and as such his biggest challenge is to find the income for this.

loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, beams and doors) to continue his building work

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a very hardworking mother. 

She regularly went to the market at 4 AM with her husband.  Her passion is to cook so she decided to sell cooked foods for the people in their village.  She sells cooked foods in front of their house and has been in business for five years now. 

Rona is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP in order to buy meat, carrots, potatoes, onions and garlic for her store.

loans.use: to buy meat, carrots, potatoes, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un hombre adulto de 61 años su vida ha sido un ejemplo de trabajo y esfuerzo, terminó la escuela primaria en su ciudad natal Riobamba y luego se trasladó para buscar mejores oportunidades con su familia. Trabajó desde muy joven, pues sus escasos recursos económicos no le permitían seguir preparándose con la educación secundaria. Luego de esto, el obstáculo más grande que él ha tenido que atravesar es la separación de su esposa con quien tuvo 5 hijos, quienes ya son adultos y tienen su vida independiente.  En la actualidad Martín vive solo en la Parroquia Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Martín gracias a un amigo aprendió la actividad de panadero y la ejerce por cuenta propia desde hace 15 años, este trabajo que demanda mucho sacrificio, fue el sustento para su familia  y para que sus hijos puedan educarse dignamente al menos hasta conseguir el bachillerato. Actualmente el menor de sus hijos, soltero y mayor de edad, le brinda ayuda en la panadería con la elaboración del pan y la venta en el local y a domicilio. Invierte en este negocio por lo menos 6 horas cada día desde antes que salga el sol para tener el pan listo y fresco para las primeras ventas de la mañana. En estos días su hijo y única ayuda en la panadería, ha tenido algunas complicaciones de salud, sin embargo Martín no ha dejado de elaborar el pan que tanto gusta a sus clientes. Ahora requiere un préstamo que lo utilizará en el mantenimiento y reparación de su horno, pues de esta forma evitará que éste se averíe y le causa demoras en la elaboración de pan como le ha estado sucediendo. Martín espera realizar este tipo de mantenimientos cada año para evitar pérdidas y que así sus ingresos mejoren y poder mejor su estilo de vida para tener una buena vejez. Martín agradece la intervención de Kiva para que personas alrededor del mundo ayuden a financiar este proyecto y también agradece a Fundación Alternativa porque es su primer crédito y se ha sentido muy cómodo con la atención y asesoría que allí le han brindado.
texts.en:
Martín, 61, sets an example of hard work and effort. He finished elementary school in his birth city of Riobamba and later moved in search of a better opportunities for his family. He started working at an early age as lack of money kept him from going to high school. Besides this, the greatest challenge he had to overcome was separating from his wife, with whom he has five grown, independent children.

Martín lives alone in Chigüilpe parish, about 15 minutes from the center of Santo Domingo, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province. Here business is very active since the area has become a commerce link between Ecuador's mountains and coast. There are cement and cement-wood houses in the parish. The river attracts many tourists and residents, who practice a variety of sports and have a chance to know the Tsáchila culture while listening to tales as they sit around a fire or camp. Santo Domingo has the third largest population in the area. Farming, raising livestock, fishing, and manufacturing are the largest industries.

Martín learned to make bread from a friend and has been working for himself for 15 years. The work demands sacrifice and has been his family's source of income and has allowed his children to study at least through high school. His youngest son is a single adult and helps Martín in the bakery, making bread and selling in the shop and delivering to homes. He works from sunup for at least six hours each day so that the bread is ready and fresh for the first sales of the morning. His son is his only help in the bakery. Martín has some health problems, but he hasn't stop making bread that his customers love.  

He needs a loan to repair and maintain his oven so that it doesn't break down and slow down production, as it doing now. Martín expects to do this type of maintenance every year to avoid losses. This way his income increases, and he can live better now and in his later years. Martín is grateful for Kiva loans that provide financing for projects around the world. He also thanks Fundación Alternativa for his first loan. He is happy with the service and counseling he has received.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his oven.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Melinde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like shampoo, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Melinde has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Melinde aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like shampoo, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Misma

texts.en:
Misma, a 54-year-old married mother of four, has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for seven years now. She also has a food vending business.

Having repaid her previous loan, Misma is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens and feeds for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a 22-year-old single mother with two children.  She owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business.  She has been in this business for almost 2 years and earns a net income of PHP 7,000/month.  She would like to receive a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.  She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can maintain a good profit and gain a high income.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a 47-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol.  She has nine children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old.  She has been in the motorcycle transportation business, “habal-habal”, for 28 years.  This is the source of her income and for the rest of the needs of the family.

Annabel is requesting a loan to maintain her motorcycle (i.e. spare parts, fuel, and a tire).  In the future, Annabel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, fuel and a tire.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelva works hard to support her family.  She has a general store in the Philippines and farms sugarcane to earn additional income.  Nelva is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries for her store, such as sardines, biscuits, soap, sugar, milk, and milk.

Nelva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old, married, with two children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a crab production in the local community. She has been with her business for over five years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase styrofoam for the crabs. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase styrofoam for the crabs.

loans.name: Rosa Irlanda

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a  la agricultura a la siembra de cacao hace 3 año. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar matas de cacao, abonos agricolas, fertilizantes y fungicidas para el cuidado de los cultivos
 
El sueño es comprar un solar y construir las casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta cocinar escuchar musica y hacer un poco de deporte
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, located in the San Francisco precinct in San Juan parish.  The members are engaged in farming.

Rosa has been growing cacao for three years.  She conducts her purchases and sales in San Juan. She is requesting the loan to purchase cacao plants, manure, fertilizers, and fungicides for crop care.  Her dream is to purchase a piece of land and build a house.  In her spare time, she enjoys cooking, listening to music, and playing a bit of sports.

loans.use: to purchase cacao trees, organic fertilizers, fertilizers, and fungicides for crop care.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 30 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

Nena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nena has been for in business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nilfa works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Nilfa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Nilfa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her restaurant, buy and sell rice.

Nilfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, sugar, soap and soft drinks for her general store business.

Rebecca has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income as a personal collection dealer.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store including sardines, sugar, soap and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 6 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos fertilizantes y fungicidas. Con el crédito le ayudara a comprar los insumos al contado.

el sueño es tener dienro para salir de viaje con la familia

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la hija a jugar.
texts.en:
Luz, 28, lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter, 6.  She lives with her husband and daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of San Juan Communal Bank, located in the San Francisco area of San Juan Parish, where people make a living in agricultural labor.

Luz earns a living in agriculture growing rice and corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in San Juan.

She's requesting the loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, and fungicide.  The loan will help her pay cash for the supplies.

Her dream is to have money to take a trip with her family.  In her free time she likes to go out and play with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, and fungicide

loans.name: Yulisa Rosanna

texts.es:
YULISA  tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Yulisa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea y fungicidas.

El sueño es tener terreno propio y vehiculo.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a los hijos y escuchar musica.
texts.en: Yulisa is 32 years old.   She is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages 16 and 12.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank located in the San Francisco precinct in San Juan parish.  The members are engaged in farming.  Yulisa grows rice and corn.  She is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, urea, and fungicides.  Her dream is to have her own land and a vehicle.  In her spare time, she enjoys spending time with her children and listening to music.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, urea, and fungicides.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, 57 years old, is married to a farmer and they were blessed with six children. They are currently residing in the village of Sta. Luciana.  

Isabel owns and operates a retail store business for almost ten years, with this business she's earning a net income of PHP 15,000 a month.  She would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase noodles, beverages, biscuits, breads, coffee, sugar, and milk.  She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, beverages, biscuits, breads, coffee, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria de material local e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pensionista há bastante tempo e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, ferro, areia, cimento, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja oficializar o seu matrimónio e concluir a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para poder trabalhar mais.
texts.en:
Regina is married and the mother of 5 children who are all of age. She lives in her own house made out of local materials and doesn't support anyone else.

She's been a pensioner for quite some time and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (stone, iron, sand, cement, blocks and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to make her marriage official and finish her house. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to stay healthy so that she can work more.

loans.use: buy construction materials (stone, iron, sand, cement, blocks and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda, a 55-year-old married mother of five, has been earning a living operating a fish pond in the Philippines for 12 years. She also raises pigs. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her fingerlings as she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her fingerlings.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Don Jose Javier vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos (15, 12 y 11 años). El mantiene a su familia de la venta de granos basicos que cultiva y los ingresos que eventualmente le genera la venta de ganado de engorde (1 animal cada 10 meses). El cultiva maiz, frijol y tambien tiene engorda ganado para venderlo con mayor peso. Solicita financiamiento para la siembra de maiz, que en su zona se dificulta por la sequedad de la tierra (excesivo calor) por lo que requiere usar el metodo de regadillo para mantener la humedad de la planta. El financiamiento tambien lo utilizara para la compra de herbicidas, porque tal como muestra la fotografia, la tierra està llena de hierbas que dificultarìan la siembra.
texts.en:
Jose Javier lives with his wife and his 3 children (15, 12 and 11 years).  He supports his family from the sale of staple foods that he grows and the income that he eventually gets from the sale of beef cattle (1 animal every 10 months).  

He grows corn and beans, and also fattens cattle to sell them at a heavier weight.  He is applying for a loan for planting corn, which is difficult in his area due to the dryness of the land (excessive heat).  It is necessary to use irrigation to maintain moisture in the plants.

He will also use the loan to buy herbicides, because as the photo shows, the land is full of weeds which would make planting difficult.

loans.use: to buy materials for planting corn.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Don Mario, vive con su esposa y sus 6 hijos (18, 16, 14, 11, y 2 de 4 años-gemelos-), en una zona eminentemente agricola ya que se ubica en las faldas de un cerro del lugar, el cultiva 5 mz de maiz y maicillo, cuya cosecha resguarda en el silo (recipiente metalico) en el que aparece en la fotografia. Necesita $700 para invertir nuevamente para preparar la tierra para la siembra (insumos como abonos, herbicidas e insecticidas) del maiz y el maicillo
texts.en:
Mario lives with his wife and six children.  There are two 4-year-old twins, and the other children are 11, 14, 16, and 18.  They live in a highly agricultural area on the slopes of a hill.

He cultivates approximately 9 acres of corn and sorghum, and stores his harvest in the metal silo that appears in the photograph.  He needs $700 so that he can prepare the land for the new planting season.  He will purchase supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Linda Maria

texts.es: Doña Linda, se dedica a la venta de alimentos para jovenes en su pequeño chalet ubicado en la escuela municipal. COn los ingresos generados por la actividad (venta de refrescos, sandwich, golosinas, etc), contribuye a sufragar los gastos del hogar, conformado por su esposo y 3 hijos (8, 13 y 15 años). Solicita el financiamiento para construir una letrina (servicio sanitario rural, que se ubica en la parte trasera de la propiedad, para los lugares en los que no se cuenta con una red sanitaria de aguas servidas o negras)
texts.en:
Linda makes a living selling food to young people in her small café in the town school.  The income she earns from this work (selling soft drinks, sandwiches, sweets, etc.) helps defray the expenses of her household, made up of her husband and three children (ages 8, 13, and 15).

She's requesting the loan to build a latrine (a rural sanitation service located at the back of the property for places that don't have a sanitary sewage system).

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a dress-making shop. Rose is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, and noodles for her general store business.

Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Rosa Jahayra

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijo, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao .Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan.

Solicita el crédito para  seguir trabajando en la agricultura comprar abonos agrícolas, semillas y fertilizantes. Con el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar lo necesario.

El sueño es comprar terrewnos para seguir sembrando y tener dinero para dar la educacion a los hijos

Le gusta hacer un poco de deporte y tener limpia la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her husband and the children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of San Juan Communal Bank, located in the San Francisco area of San Juan Parish.  The members are farmers.

She makes a living in agriculture growing cacao.  She makes her purchases and sales in San Juan.

She's requesting the loan to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer so she can continue working in agriculture.  The loan will be a big help to her for buying what she needs.

Her dream is to buy plots of land to continue planting and to have money for her children's education.

She likes to play some sports and keep her house clean.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Hola  de Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 9  socios responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de ate santa clara. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “virgen de Guadalupe de santa clara” una de ellas es la Sra. Carla de 31 años de edad soltera y con dos  hijos, la Sra. Carla se dedica ya hace 7 años a la venta de verduras (abarrotes, papas, choclos, cebollas  etc.)  en un pequeño mercado todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos y pagar los gastos de su casa  , su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Carla trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más abarrotes  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo diciéndoles que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú.  The communal bank “Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara” is comprised of 9 responsible members who are involved in various business activities.  They all reside in the district of Ate Santa Clara.

One member is Carla, who is a single mother of two children.  For the last 7 years she has been selling groceries and vegetables including potatoes, corn and onions in a small market.   She works every day to get ahead and be able to send her children to school and cover the household expenses.

Her greatest wish is to see her children have professional careers.  It is for this reason that she works so hard.

She will invest the loan proceeds in groceries for resale so that she can increase her income.  In closing she sends her warm wishes to Kiva and Edaproso and says that she hopes that they achieve all of their goals.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
This is Noime. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products needed in her variety store. This has been her business for twenty years now and it continues to grow.  Aside from her variety store, Noime also has a junk shop to earn additional income. She and her husband, who is a businessman, work hard to continuously cover their everyday expenses.  She has six children and most of them are still in school. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noime hopes for the continuous growth of her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories about her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ubalda Nicolasa

texts.es:
ubalda tien 63 años es casada tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y cadados vive con el esposo en ventanas provincia de los rios.

Es miembro de la Ventanilla San Juan es nueva se dedica a la agricultura. esta ubicada en ventanas provincia de los rios.

Ubalda se dedica a la siembra de arroz y maiz, el credito lo solicita para la compra de semillas urea fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos.

El sueño de ella es crecer como productora y comprar un vehiculo

le gusta ver television y escuhar musica.
texts.en:
Ubalda is 63 years old and married with four adult children.  She lives with her husband in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.  

She is a member of the solidarity group San Juan, which is newly dedicated to agriculture and is located in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

Ubalda works planting rice and corn, and is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost for her crops.

Her dream is to grow as a producer and to purchase a vehicle.

She enjoys watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost for her crops.

loans.name: 010501Xuân Phụ - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Cúc is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 010501 Xuân Phụ - Hoằng Phụ solidarity group. 
Cúc supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Cúc has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Cúc hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 56 years old, married and has one child.  

Rosenda is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosenda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables.

Rosenda has been farming vegetables for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has three children and has been doing this work for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and a job salary.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture especially from the sale of milk!' His biggest challenge is 'Low financial resources to boost agricultural production.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuiyobei, chamuit". He will use the loan to buy a chaff cutter and a water tank.

John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Knew about Juhudi from neighbours and friends.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How I can use funds from the MFI to acquire assets for agricultural purposes.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', John replied 'Will purchase a chaff cutter and a water tank to be used in dairy production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and a water tank.

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
Cesar tien 22 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con dos hijos pequeños vive en ventanas provincia de los rios.

Pertenece a la ventanillas SAN JUAN se dedican a la agronomia y a la pecuaria. esta ventanilla esta ubicada en ventanas provincia de los rios.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maiz ademas cria cerdos y gallinas, el credito solicita para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abono tambien balanceado para los pollos y cerdos.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 22-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two small children.  They live in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.

He belongs to the community bank San Juan and makes his living raising crops and livestock. He grows corn and rice and also raises pigs and roosters.

Cesar is seeking this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost, as well as animal feed for his pigs and roosters. His dream is to buy a piece of land so that he can continue planting his crops.  In his free time he likes to play sports and go out with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has two children and has been doing this work for three years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, personal business. She will use the loan to construct a dairy unit.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Rearing livestock for income generation!' Her biggest challenge is 'Lack of skills and funds on how to increase dairy production.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Maua.'

Edna was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Learned about Juhudi  through a friend.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How I could boost dairy production through micro finance.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Edna replied 'Will use the funds to construct a dairy unit for the cow.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Edna owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar is a 59-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is retired from his job and currently he is not doing any job. Her eldest son owns a small beauty salon and as his mother, she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. 

With the loan amount he will purchase cosmetic products and some other beauty products including facial creams, scrubs, etc. Sarwar is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her son's business. 

Note: In the picture Sarwar is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and some other beauty products including facial creams, scrubs, etc for her son's beauty salon.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old, married and blessed with three children. She manages a vegetable-vending business where she sells onion, garlic, and ginger at the public market of Cauayan city. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase 1,000 kilos of onions, 7 kilos of garlic, and 150 kilos of ginger. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase 1,000 kilos of onions, 7 kilos of garlic, and 150 kilos of ginger.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a 46-year-old mother who owns and manages a small eatery in the local community. She aims to improve the business and make it more profitable in order to generate sufficient income for the education of her children and to satisfy their necessities. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and raw ingredients which she needs to cook and sell in the eatery. She is hoping that someday, she will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy the fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and raw ingredients she needs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Violly

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Violly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Violly is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, soap, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Violly has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hardwork will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, soap, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hector Ovidio

texts.es: Don Hector es una persona amable y trabajadora, dedicada al cultivo en la zona en la que habita. con sus ingresos mantiene a su grupo familiar (padre de 71 años y su hermano de 30 años), a sus 35 años, posee una gran experiencia de 10 años dedicado al cultivo de 1 manzana para producir maiz. No tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, por lo que aprendio el oficio de agricultor de su padre, quien siempre se ha dedicado a la actividad. El solicita $250 para comprar los insumos que necesita para preparar la tierra (herbicidas) y luego cuidar el cultivo (abonos e insecticidas)
texts.en:
Hector is a friendly and hardworking person.  He grows crops in the area where he lives.  With his income he supports his family (his 71-year-old father and 30-year-old brother).  At his own age of 35, he has 10 years of experience cultivating approximately two acres of corn.  He did not have the opportunity to go to college.  Thus, he learned the business of farming from his father, who has been a farmer his whole life.

He is seeking a loan of $250 in order to buy the supplies he needs in order to prepare the land (herbicides) and to later take care of the crops (fertilizers and insecticides).

loans.use: to make investments to support his corn crops.

loans.name: Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité “Joaju” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 12 señoras muy trabajadoras. Todos los integrantes de este comité se dedican a la cría y venta de animales. Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Victoriana solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales, los cuales quiere poder faenar y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que así están saliendo adelante y por medio de su esfuerzo ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Joaju” was formed by a group of neighbors in the city of Santaní.  The group is comprised of 12 very hardworking women.  All of the members are involved in raising and selling animals.  They are a very united group and they are all able to help one another.

Victoriana is seeking a loan so that she can invest in animals.  She will then butcher these animals and continue making sales.  She is grateful for this opportunity for the group, since thanks to this support they are able to get ahead and help their families through their hard work.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Valenina

texts.en:
Valenina is 57 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Valenina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her sugarcane business.

Valenina has been farming sugarcane for 29 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her sugarcane business.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 37-year-old single lady living with her parents. At home she works on making and arranging decorative pieces in the shape of flowers. Then, she sells them at a whole-sale market. 

She hopes that one day she can open her own store. But now, Nisreen is applying for a loan to buy more material with different colors to increase the quantity of her production.

loans.use: to buy more materials of different colors.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is 47 years old. She is a very hardworking and excellent tailor. She is a mother of eight children. Her husband is a driver. Jameela lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Presently, she is interested in purchasing a sewing machine for her daughter so that her daughter can help her in the business. With this, she can save time and earn more money. 

With the help of her profits, she wants to increase her business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Paksitan.

Note: In the picture, Jameela is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support her family. Marianita is married and has a buying-and-selling spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.

Marianita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

Marianita has been in this business for 23 years now. In the future, Marianita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 33 years old and married to a farmer. They were gifted with three children, and they live happily in a rural community. 

To earn a living, Flordeliza engages in a hog-raising business while her husband cultivates their farm land. Due to financial difficulty, she aimed to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will be a great help to her in making improvements to the business. She hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 42 years old and married, with three children.

Denia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, toothpaste, spices, soap, and canned goods.

Denia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a fruit stand. Denia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, toothpaste, spices, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta, who is 34 years old, is married to a truck driver. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling dried fish in their village for almost three years. She earns a net income of Php 6,000. She would like to get a loan amount of Php 15,000 to purchase dried fish to sell. She's hoping that her business will become profitable so that she can gain more money.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Hector Adolfo

texts.es:
HECTOR  tiene 29 años de edad vive en union libre tiene un hijo, vive en  Chimbo con la esposa y con el hijo en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

HECTOR  es mecanico trabaja en un taller en su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar rodelas, gata, grasa, aceite, ejes. Con la yuda del crédito podra incrementar el negocio.

Las compras lo realiza en Guaranda. y el trabaja bajo pedido.

El sueño es poder comprar y mejorar el estilo de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
Hector is 29-years-old. He lives in a civil union with his son. He lives in Chimbo with his wife and his song in the Chimbo providence in Bolivar. 

Hector is a mechanic he works in a shop in his house. He is requesting the loan to purchase targets, jacks, grease, oil and axels. With the help of the loan he will be able to increase his business. 

The purchases will be completed in Guaranda and he works by request. His dream is to be able to purchase and improve his style of life. In his free time he likes to bowl.

loans.use: to purchase targets, jacks, grease, oil, and axels.

loans.name: Gabriel Yasmani

texts.es:
GABRIEL  tiene 26 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 6 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

GABRIEL se dedica a realizar trabajos de construcción el es Albañil. Solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas como taladro, pala, espátula, mezcladora pequeña. 


El sueño es comprarse un carro.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y hacer deporte
texts.en:
Gabriel is 26 years old and single. He has one child. He lives with his six-year-old son in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

Gabriel works in construction. He is a bricklayer. He is requesting a loan to purchase tools, such as a drill, a shovel, a spatula, and a small mixer.

His dream is to buy himself a car.

In his free time he enjoys watching television and playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase tools, such as a drill, a shovel, a spatula, and a small mixer.

loans.name: Angel Gustavo

texts.es:
Angel es casado tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en casa arrendada en Chimbo.

Angel trabaja de chofer de un bus trabaja de lunes a sabado, el credito lo solicita para la comprar de lavadora, licuadora y algunos viveres de primera necesidad para el hogar, el credito le ayudado a comprar las cosas de contado y se ha podido ahorrar un poco.


El sueño de angel es no les falta nada a la esposa y a los hijos 

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la familia a pasear.
texts.en:
Angel is married with three children. He lives with his family in a house in Chimbo. Angel works as a bus driver from Monday to Saturday. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a washing machine, blender and other necessary household items. The loan will help to purchase these few items and he has been able to save a little. 

Angel’s dream is to for his wife and his children not to want for anything. In his free time he likes to go out walking with his family.

loans.use: to purchase washing machine, blender, and other items of basic necessity

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Janet Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Janet del Socorro es profesora docente de unos de los colegios públicos de la ciudad de león desde hace mas de 25 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos,  siendo este trabajo además de un apostolado, el sustento de su familia por mucho tiempo
.
La Señora Janet del Socorro es madre de dos hijos uno de  cuales estudian y por sus bajos ingresos se a complicado comprar los útiles escolares y la matrícula, siendo ya cliente se acercó a ceprodel  para solicitar apoyo y así  sufragar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Janet del Socorro has been a teacher in one of the public schools in the city of León for more than 25 years, giving her students the bread of knowledge.  This job has been a calling as well as the support of her family for a long time.

Janet del Socorro is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school.  It has become difficult to buy school supplies and pay tuition because of her low income.  She's already a CEPRODEL client, so she went to request support to defray these expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies and to pay tuition

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 48 años es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en chimbo provincia de bolivar.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, el credito lo solicita para la comprar se semillas, abonos, incticidas y fertilizantes para los cultivos.

El credito le ayudado a adquirir lo necesario para proteger los cultivos.

El sueño es tener dinero para seguir invertiendo en los cultivos y algun dia comprar un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 48-years-old. He is married with two children. He lives with his wife and his kids in the Chimbo providence of Bolivia. 

Miguel works in agriculture in the harvest of corn. The loan that his requesting will be used to purchase seeds, manure, insecticides, and fertilizer for the crops. The loan will help him to acquire the necessary items to protect the crops. 

His dream is to have money to continue to invest in the harvest and one day to purchase a car. 

He likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, insecticides, and fertilizer for the crops

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising poultry  in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her chickens.

Cecilia has been in the poultry business for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her chickens

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Mr. Abdul Hameed is an electrician by profession. He owns an electrical goods shop in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of four children and his wife is a responsible and hardworking housewife.

Mr. Abdul Hameed is the only earning person in the family. He has requested a loan amount of 100,000Pkr from BRAC Pakistan to purchase various spare parts and electrical components such as capacitors, terminals, connecters, small transformers, resistors, diodes, etc. for the shop. With the profit he wants to put aside some savings for his family's future needs.

He dreams about the bright future of his children. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase various spare parts and electrical components for the shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan offers fish, meat, vegetables and frozen foods within her local community. She has been doing this kind of business for two years. In addition to the food production and sales business, she also manages a corn farm and a livestock business, wherein she raises four sows, one boar and seven hogs to be fattened. 

Though they don’t have children yet, she is still grateful because of her husband's support of her businesses. Susan would like to increase the kilograms of fish and meat she offers due to harvest season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000. She hopes to receive this loan amount in order for her to earn better income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional kilograms of fish and meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es: Dinora vive con sus hijos (16, 13, 11 y 6 años) que aun estudian, y su esposo de 46 años que trabaja como albañil. Ella se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos (maiz y maicillo) en 1 1/2 manzana. Los productos de su cultivo le generan ingresos por venta de granos que le permiten hacer frente a los gastos del hogar que junto con su esposo que recibe el salario minimo (USS$200/mes) sobrellevan los gastos del hogar. En la fotografia se observan los silos (recipientes de aluminio para resguardar los granos basicos recolectados) y herramientas que utiliza para el cultivo. Ella solicita $300 para la compra de herbicidas, insecticidas y abono, ya que se acerca la temporada agricola y debe preparar su tierra.
texts.en: Dinora lives with her children, ages 16, 13, 11, and 6, who all attend school.  Her 46 year old husband works as a bricklayer.  She is engaged in growing basic grains (corn and sorghum) on 1 ½ “manzanas” (a unit of land area equivalent to 1.7 acres).  She generates income by selling the grains that she grows and this permits her to meet the household expenses. Together with her husband, who earns minimum wage ($200 US dollars per month), they bear the household expenses.  In the photograph, you can see silos (aluminum containers that protect the harvested grains) and tools used in cultivation.  She is requesting the loan to purchase herbicides, insecticides, and organic fertilizer because the growing season is approaching and she must prepare her land.  .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, semillas, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha vive desde hace 40 años en esta ciudad, se podría decir que toda su vida que realmente así lo es, es una persona muy comprometida con su trabajo en donde tiene dos años de estar laborando y por supuesto con su familia. Tiene dos hijos, es por eso que pide apoyo a traves KIVA porque quiere terminar de construir un cuarto para que sea la recamara de su hijo el mayor, para que así cada hermano tenga su propio espacio.

La Sra. Bertha es encargada de una tienda comercial muy reconocida, planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene en esa actividad comercial, en donde también trabaja uno de sus hijos, es una gran familia muy trabajadora y responsable que tienen el deseo de salir adelante, ya que con su gran esfuerzo la Sra. Bertha y su esposo han logrado construir su casa poco a poco.

Con este crédito otorgado serán dos créditos obtenidos a traves de KIVA.
texts.en:
Bertha has lived in this city for forty years. You could say she has lived here all her life, because that is really the case. She is very dedicated to her job - where she has been working for two years - and of course to her family. She has two children, and that is why she is asking for help through Kiva. She wants to finish building a room for her older son to use as a bedroom, so that each sibling can have their own space.

Bertha manages a very well-known retail store. She is planning to pay back this loan with the income she makes from this retail business, where one of her children also works. They are a great family, very hardworking and responsible, and they want to get ahead. Through much effort, Bertha and her husband have been able to build their house little by little.

This will be her second loan obtained through Kiva.

loans.use: to build a concrete roof.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Adresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling live lobsters, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Adresita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lobsters to sell. She successfully paid off her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her lobster business.

Adresita would like to save money for the future, which she will use to expand her business and finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more live lobsters to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a hydraulic lift, car keys, tires, etc.

loans.name: Saira Tomasa

texts.es:
Saira, se dedica a la venta de comida y antojitos, vive con sus padres de 60 y 61 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, sus padres son independientes, Ella realiza el negocio de manera ambulante desde hace dos años, lo aprendió trabajando en comedores, esto le dio la experiencia para dedicarse por sus propios medios al negocio.
Ella necesita realizar la inversión al negocio, para mejorar en los productos que ofrece, solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en maíz, frijoles, arroz, carnes, azúcar, sal, productos plásticos, entre otros gastos que le ayudaran a mejorar el negocio.
La aspiración de Saira es salir adelante con su familia, con la ayuda de los prestamos espera tener un mejor negocio para trabajar.
texts.en:
Saira sells meals and snacks. She lives with her parents who are 60 and 61 years old. She has a two-year-old son. Her parents are self-sufficient. She has had her street vendor business for two years. She learned it working in restaurants. This gave her experience to dedicate her own resources to the business.

She needs to invest in the business. To improve the products that she offers, she is requesting a loan and will invest it in corn, beans, rice, meats, sugar, salt, plastic products, and other expenses that will help her improve her business.

Saira's goal is to progress with her family, with the help of the loans, she hopes to have a better business to work.

loans.use: purchase corn, beans, rice, meats, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plantains and a bicycle to sell them.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, and she earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials, like nets, bamboo, etc., to use in her fishing business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials, like nets, bamboo, etc., for use in her fishing business

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Don Abelardo, 53 años un humilde comerciante, originario de Mal paisillo, en las afueras de León, casado, padre de 4 hijos,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortilla, del que es propietario  hace  mas de 4 años, por la situación económica en que vivía solo logro terminar su primer año de secundaria. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 48 años,  con capital propio, el cual comenzó con  10 libras de maíz para hacer sus tortillas, con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo el ha podido salir adelante con su negocio porque es muy rentable. Hoy en día el trabaja con dos personas mas que le ayudan hacer sus tortillas, porque la demanda de su productos han crecido cada día, ya que sus clientes le encargan por mayor las tortillas. Sus expectativas es crecer en su negocio como un gran  empresario exitoso, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.
Don Abelardo esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar 10  quintales de maíz,  leña y  al mismo tiempo comprar zinc, maderas. Ya que el estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas, y a la misma vez  mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias,  sus planes futuros  es construir  una casa para poder ampliar mas su negocio, una de sus metas próximas es poder cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
53-year-old Abelardo is a small businessman from Mal Paisillo, on the outskirts of León.  He is married and the father of four children.  Abelardo's business is making and selling tortillas.  He has owned his own tortilla business for more than 4 years now.  Owing to his family's poor financial situation, he was only able to complete his first year of secondary school.  He established his own business at the age of 48 with his own capital.  He started out making his own tortillas with just 10 pounds of corn.  Through a lot of hard work and effort, he has been able to make progress in his business which is now very profitable.  Abelardo has two employees who help him make his tortillas.  His goal is to grow his business and become a successful businessman.  He has the support of his wife.

Abelardo is requesting a loan to buy ten 100lb bags of corn and some firewood.  He will also buy metal sheeting and wood.  He believes that this loan will help him to buy all the raw materials that he needs to make his tortillas.  He will also be able to improve the infrastructure of his business premises and thereby offer a better service to his customers.  His aim is to increase his sales and make more profits.  His future plans are to build a house so that he can further expand his business.  One of his short-term goals is to pay back his loan.

loans.use: to buy ten 100lb sacks of corn and some firewood.  He will also buy metal sheeting and wood

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy offers different kinds of vegetables, meat, fish and other ingredients in his food stall. He is happy to see that his sales and profits are increasing through the help of lenders. He has received four loans from a lending institution and he is really grateful, because his determination pushes him to strive hard to get ahead of life.

At this time, four of his children are going to school, so he needs to double his efforts to educate his children, sustain his family’s daily needs and improve his financial stability. To realize his goals, he is seeking additional capital of 13,000 Philippine pesos to buy more stock of vegetables, meat, fish and other ingredients. By satisfying his customer's demands, he knows he can gain greater income and improve his way of life. 

He hopes and prays that he will be granted his requested loan amount to realize his goals.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables, meat, fish and other ingredients for his food stall

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es sastre, vive solo, ofrece clases de sastrería de manera independiente, él se dedico a este oficio desde joven, ayudándole a un vecino a realizar costuras, su horario es de 9:00am a 5:00pm.
Solicita un préstamo que le ayude a comprarse dos maquinas para coser, ya que no cuenta con el dinero y busca este apoyo que le ayudara para la costura de uniformes y entregarlos a las escuelas.
La aspiración de Juan es tener una escuela de sastrería, ayudando a más personas a que aprendan este oficio, ya que les ayudara para la vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a tailor. He lives alone. He independently offers tailoring classes. He has been in this business since he was young, helping a neighbor make outfits. His working hours are 9 am to 5 pm.

He is requesting a loan that will help him purchase two machines for sewing because he does not have the money, and he is looking for this support that will help him make uniforms and deliver them to schools.

Juan's goal is to have a tailoring school, helping more people learn this trade because it will help them in life.

loans.use: purchase two machines for sewing.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and widowed, but nowadays she has a live-in partner. She has three children from her former husband, and two children whose father is her live-in partner. Two of her children are Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW), one child is a farmer, and the other two children are still studying. 

Carmelita has been operating her variety store and school canteen for 25 years. She also runs her three hectares of corn farming and livestock business. Carmelita would like to buy stock for the variety store -- specifically, grocery items, such as soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, flour, and instant noodles. Unfortunately, her capital intended for her store is no longer enough. With regard to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She knows that this amount would help her much, especially in improving her financial stability and way of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store's inventory, such as soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, flour, and instant noodles.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Don Luis esta casado y tiene 3 hijos (3, 5 y 7 años). Su nivel educativo es de 6to grado y se dedica a la agricultura. Es una persona muy trabajadora y conocida en su comunidad. El cultiva maiz y maicillo; tambien tiene 3 vacas para la produccion lechera y cuida una propiedad. El vive en una casa ubicada en la propiedad que cuida, pero desea construir su propia vivienda, por lo que solicita credito a INTEGRAL para hacer realidad el sueño de ofrecer un techo digno a su familia. En la fotografia se observa, al fondo el silo en el que resguarda los granos que ha cosechado, algunas aves de corral, los reservorios de agua (recipientes plasticos o barriles, ya que no cuenta con servicio de agua potable a domicilio), piso de tierra, techo de teja de barro sostenido por estructura de madera rustica (troncos de arboles); lo cual demuestra la necesidad de contar con una vivienda que brinde cobertura y seguridad minima a su familia
texts.en:
Luis is married and has three children, ages 3, 5, and 7.  He has a sixth-grade education and works in agriculture.

He's a very hardworking person who's well known in his community.  He grows rice and sorghum.  He also has three dairy cows and takes care of a piece of property.  He lives in a house located on that property, but he wants to build his own house so he's asking Integral for a loan to make his dream of giving his family a decent home come true.

In the photograph, behind the silo that holds the grain he has harvested are some poultry, water reservoirs (plastic recipients or barrels, because he doesn't have potable running water at home), a dirt floor, and a clay tile roof held up by rustic wood (tree trunks).  This demonstrates his need to have a home that gives his family shelter and minimal security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Don Cristóbal  tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero tiene 4 hijos y vive con dos de ellas en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Don Cristóbal se dedica desde hace 3 años al cultivo de café.  La zona donde el vive es apta para estos cultivos, la cosecha que saca lo vende en pergamino en el mercado local, la paga del café dice que es rentable y se mantiene.
Ha Obtenido con Odef 3 créditos y ahora pide el cuarto de 22,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante, y mantenimiento general de la finca. Este préstamo le ayudo mucho en ya que pudo dar al cultivo el mantenimiento necesario para sacar una buena cosecha.
Su meta es seguir mejorando sus cultivos y sembrar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, age 47, is single and has 4 children.  He lives with two of them in a village in Taulabe, Comayagua.

Cristóbal has been growing coffee for three years.  The area where he lives is suitable for these crops.  He sells the harvest that he gets as parchment coffee [dried, but un-hulled coffee beans] at the local market.  The payment for coffee is profitable and remains steady.

He has received three loans with ODEF.  He is now asking for the fourth in the amount of 22,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and for general maintenance of the farm.

This loan helped him a lot.  He was able to give his crops the needed maintenance in order to get a good harvest.  His goal is to continue improving his crops and to plant a little more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to perform general maintenance on the farm.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 31 years old and lives in a place that is known to be mountainous and whose primary source of income comes from corn farming.  Her aim is to have a stable source of income for a better way of life and to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

Christina has run and operated her variety store for almost seven years. She is indeed thankful because, with patience and hard work, she has been able to obtain a better income. 

With regards to her business, she is asking for additional capital of 13,000 Philippine pesos. This amount will be used to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil and other groceries for her variety store. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan amount so she can attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil and other groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Miguel Angel Coreas

texts.es:
Miguel, es sastre, aprendió el negocio de su familia, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 24 y 18 años de edad, depende económicamente de él. Miguel aprendió la sastrería hace 30 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana, hasta el momento no presenta dificultad realizar este oficio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para complementar la construcción de un muro en la vivienda, esto le dará mayor seguridad para su familia y mejorar su condición en el hogar.
Los sueños de Miguel es poder tener una vivienda construida en la totalidad, para la comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a tailor. He learned the business from his family. He lives with his wife and two children who are 24 and 18 years old. They depend on him economically. Miguel learned tailoring 30 years ago. He works every day of the week. Up until now, no difficulty has arisen for this business.

He is requesting a loan to do construction on a wall in his home. This would give his family better security and improve the condition of the home.

Miguel's dream is to be able to have a completely finished home for his family's comfort.

loans.use: to do construction on a wall in his home.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 45 años y se dedica a la construcción y su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Anteriormente el señor vendía helados y luego aprendió el oficio de albañilería, y hoy en día ya se hizo de muy buena fama, ya que hace muy buenos trabajos y siempre se destaca en ello.
El es una persona que trabaja duro por ayudar a su familia y por darles todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades.
El crédito lo utilizó para comprar ladrillos, tejas, cemento y arena hacer una pieza más, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Reinaldo is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  He is 45 years old and works in construction.  His wife sells fruits and vegetables.  Previously, Reinaldo sold ice cream and then he learned the bricklaying trade.  Today, he has already earned a very good reputation because he does very good work and it always stands out.  He is a person who works very hard to support his family and provide everything that they need and in this way, prevents them from having to do without.  He will use the loan to purchase bricks, tiles, cement, and sand to build another room and this will enable him to continue working and supporting his family.  .

loans.use: to purchase bricks, tiles, cement, and sand

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de aperturar otro negocio para los fines de semana en canchas deportivas, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos comestibles como gaseosas, agua, jugos, maíz, aceite, queso, carne y otros productos, con esto ella lograra instalar una venta de bebidas y pupusas en otro punto de la zona. 
Con el préstamo anterior María, tuvo una experiencia positiva, aumentaron sus ventas, su disponibilidad de dinero y la capacidad para pagar sus obligaciones, su familia está estable.
texts.en:
María needs to open another business for the weekends at sports fields. For this, she is requesting a new loan to purchase edibles such as sodas, water, juices, corn, cooking oil, cheese, meat, and other products. With this, she will open a stand to sell drinks and stuffed tortillas in another location in the area.

With Maria's earlier loan, Maria had a positive experience. She grew her sales, liquidity, and the ability to pay her bills. Her family is stable.

loans.use: purchase sodas, water, juices, corn, cooking oil, cheese, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 51-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has five grown children. The eldest is 31 and the youngest is 16 years old. 

Lydia has been in the food vending business for 25 years. She sells cassava cakes. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy sugar, coconut and cassava. These are the ingredients in her cassava cakes. With this loan, she will be able to continue her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fumigation pumps for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo y en la venta de plátanos, vive con su padre en la misma vivienda, él está soltero, tiene cuatro años de estar produciendo en el negocio lo aprendió al comprar un terreno donde cultivan plátano, pipián y maíz al ver este cultivo fue de su agrado y por lo mismo se esmero en aprenderlo y seguir desarrollando.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la siembra en la finca de plátanos, comprando abono, semilla, gasolina y pago de mano de obra, para preparar el terreno, ya que quiere aprovechar el terreno para continuar en la producción, esto le ayudará para quien tenga una fuente de ingreso y de trabajo, poder abastecer el mercado, espera no tener riesgos durante la producción y sus ganancias serían mayores ya que él terreno es propio.

La aspiración es crecer en el mercado, teniendo la oportunidad de proveer a quienes se dedican al menudeo de la venta de plátanos y poder mejorar su condición en el trabajo y sus ingresos personales.
texts.en:
José makes a living growing and selling bananas.  He's single and lives with his father in the same house.  He has been working in this business for four years.  He learned it when he bought a piece of land with banana, chili pepper, and corn crops.  He liked this crop and took pains to learn about it and continue developing it.

He's requesting a loan to be able to do the planting on his banana farm.  He's going to buy fertilizer, seed, and gasoline, and pay for labor to prepare the land, because he wants to make the most of the land to continue with the crop.

This will help him have a source of income and of work, and be able to supply the market.  He hopes that there won't be any danger during the production and that his profits will be greater since the land is his own.

He wants to grow in the market, have the opportunity to supply those who sell bananas retail, and be able to improve his job status and his personal income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and gasoline, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, lentes y artículos de temporada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos estudian, ella aprendió este negocio hace 5 años son la madre de su esposo, ahora lo realiza con su esposo, tienen un pick up para el transporte de mercadería, su horario es de 7:00am a 8:00 am, o dependiendo de la temporada.
Ella solicita un préstamo para surtir el negocio, comprando ropa para baño, como trajes de baño, calzonetas, bermudas, artículos flotantes, ropa de moda, esto le ayudara a vender más, para la temporada de verano, con las posibilidades de obtener mejores ganancias. La aspiración de María es tener un negocio fuerte, trabajando con dinero propio.
texts.en:
María sells new clothing, glasses and seasonal items.  She lives with her husband and their three children, who are 8, 10 and 15 years of age.  All of the children are in school.
